head.title: The Court's Term Is Over, but Not the Discord; The School Aid Ruling

hedline.hl1: The Court's Term Is Over, but Not the Discord; The School Aid Ruling

abstract.p: Roger B Blumberg letter warns that Supreme Court ruling approving financing of religious' schools equipment makes clear that Establishment Clause is too weak to protect public education system (S)

block.p: Re ''Justices Approve U.S. Financing of Religious Schools' Equipment'' (news article, June 29):
Re ''Justices Approve U.S. Financing of Religious Schools' Equipment'' (news article, June 29):

Justice David H. Souter is no doubt correct in asserting that the majority decision in Mitchell v. Helms represents a break with the Supreme Court's precedents, but more important, the decision makes clear that the Establishment Clause is simply too weak to preserve our system of public education.

Advocates of a voucher system hardly need fuel or momentum in the absence of a national commitment to superior public schooling. In our consumerist frenzy, we seem unwilling to make or even to discuss such a commitment. Sadly, this comes at a time when our colleges and universities are least willing or able to compel students to engage in the studies that might provide the basis for such a discussion or commitment.
ROGER B. BLUMBERG Providence, R.I., June 29, 2000
